metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9076 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The dccp_v6_request_recv_sock function in net/dccp/ipv6.c in the Linuxkernel through 4.11.1 mishandles inheritance, which allows local users tocause a denial of service or possibly have unspecified other impact viacrafted system calls, a related issue to CVE-2017-8890.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9076` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-83.106
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-83.106
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-83.106
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1061-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1061.69
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1063-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1063.68
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1022.31
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-58.63~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-58.63~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.8.0-58.63~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1018-gke - 4.4.0-1018.18
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1018-gke - 4.4.0-1018.18
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.10.0-1004.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.13.0-1008-oem - 4.13.0-1008.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-83.106').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').

linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.0-1009.9').
